member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UC.CcsUcCodec200.CcsUcCodec200DmInput.DisabledByHdcpFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the HDMI output (HDMI OUT) has been disabled as the result of a failure during HDCP authentication. This occurs when HDCP (High-bandwidth Digital Copy Protection) is detected at the HDMI input, but the display or other loopback device is not HDCP compliant. This also occurs when the maximum number of display devices that can be used with the video source (based on the application of keys and KSVs) has been exceeded. The maximum number of keys is reported by "VideoAttributes.MaximumSupportedHdcpKeysFeedback".
The event will trigger with .
member.returns: 'true' = HDMI OUT disabled by HDCP; 'false = DMI OUT not disabled by HCDP

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UC.UcEngine
member.summary:
The Crestron UC Engine for Microsoft Teams forms the core of a complete Microsoft Teams-based Crestron Flex system--providing a video conferencing and content sharing solution with extreme processing performance, Gigabit Ethernet, and complete connectivity for one or two HD displays, a USB camera, and a USB audio conferencing device.
This class will trigger and events.

The Crestron UC Engine for Microsoft Teams with Single Display forms the core of a complete Microsoft Teams-based Crestron Flex system--providing a video conferencing and content sharing solution with extreme processing performance, Gigabit Ethernet, and complete connectivity for one or two HD displays, a USB camera, and a USB audio conferencing device.
This class will trigger and events.

The Crestron UC Engine for Zoom Rooms with Single Display forms the core of a complete Zoom Room-based Crestron Flex system, providing extreme processing performance, Gigabit Ethernet and complete connectivity for one HD display, a USB camera and one USB audio conferencing device. Basic TriList and SmartGraphics features are not supported by this device.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UC.Am100
member.summary:
The AM-100 (AirMedia™) Presentation Gateway is a wireless presentation product for small conference rooms and classrooms. Using AirMedia, the presenter/user connects a laptop or mobile device over the local Wi-Fi network to begin displaying the user’s content through the room display. Firmware version 1.1.0.8 or newer is required.
This class will trigger "OnBaseEvent" event with event Id's defined under .
